comments:
I20040527(0800)
- clean workspace
- close welcome screen
- turn off autobuild
- load platform-ui projects from CVS Repository (I think this is when the 
problem happened, so the rest of the steps are likely not relevant but I have 
put them here in case they are)
- switch to Java perspective
- load all other projects as binary
- try to launch Eclipse within Eclipse (forces a rebuild as I forgot to turn 
autobuild on)
- while the build is running I turned on autobuild in my preferences
- 2nd Eclipse starts up
- close welcome screen in 2nd Eclipse
- shutdown 2nd Eclipse
- in first Eclipse File->New->Project->Plugin Project
- give it a name (Test2) when prompted and use the default for everything else
- Error Log comes up with "Exception while synchronizing" and the following is 
in the .log file:

Same build. I found the same exception.

I just found that one of my editors did not save its modified content to disk
and the dirty flag was no longer reported in the editor tab. This is the only
exception I found in the log. Closing and reopening that CU worked.
had the same trace when reverting. Folding was on.
Note that OverviewRuler#doubleBufferPaint() is called recursively.

Got it when replacing two files with "Latest from HEAD" after having changed
them via File Search, Replace Selected... .

Partial fix goes into I200405281200.

A performance optimization in ProjectionViewer triggered this. The real fix
would be to (in AnnotationModel):
- synchronize the manipulation of the model event and the annotations map
- synchronize the manipulation of the model event alone
- on getAnnotationIterator(): create a new thread in cleanup(true) to call
fireModelChanged()

The performance optimization in ProjectionViewer could then be reconsidered.
*** Bug 64625 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

FYI: I just go this on I20040529-0105 while I was checking out and 
synchronizing and had a java editor open on a java file, I resized the window 
small then large a few times and it caused this exception.

I also got this exception from the new progress viewer:
